'''Gojira''' is a French [[heavy metal music|heavy metal]] band from [[Bayonne]]. Originally formed as '''Godzilla''' in 1996, they changed their name to Gojira in 2001 prior to releasing any studio albums. The band's lineup, consisting of brothers [[Joe Duplantier]] (vocals, guitars) and [[Mario Duplantier]] (drums) as well as guitarist [[Christian Andreu]] and bassist [[Jean-Michel Labadie]], has been the same since then. They have released six studio albums and three live DVDs. They are known for their [[Natural environment|environmentally]]-themed lyrics and have gone from "utmost obscurity" to being placed "amongst the genre's leading new millennium upstarts".<ref>[{{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p822709/biography|pure_url=yes}} Gojira] at [[AllMusic]]</ref>
==History==
===Early years and ''Terra Incognita'' (1996−2002)=== Gojira was formed in 1996 by Joe and Mario Duplantier, Christian Andreu, and Alexandre Cornillon in their hometown of [[Ondres]]. Gojira's music combines elements of death metal, groove metal, thrash metal and progressive metal. The band started touring and recording under the name Godzilla and released their demos ''[[Victim (album)|Victim]]'', ''[[Possessed (Gojira album)|Possessed]]'', ''[[Saturate (Gojira album)|Saturate]]'' and ''[[Wisdom Comes]]'' in 1996, 1997, 1999 and 2000, respectively. After touring, supporting [[Cannibal Corpse]], [[Edge of Sanity]], [[Impaled Nazarene]] and supporting [[Immortal (band)|Immortal]] in September 1999,<ref name="MSGB"> {{cite web | url = http://www.metalstorm.ee/bands/biography.php?band_id=475&bandname=Gojira | title = Gojira Biography | publisher = Metal Storm | accessdate = 2008-05-04 }}</ref> legal problems forced Godzilla to change their name. They changed their name to Gojira, the [[rōmaji]] spelling of the fictional monster [[Godzilla]].<ref name="TGGB"> {{cite web | url = http://www.thegauntlet.com/bio/1611/Gojira.html | publisher = The Gauntlet | title = Gojira Biography | accessdate = 2008-05-04 }}</ref> Their debut album ''[[Terra Incognita (Gojira album)|Terra Incognita]]'' was released under the new name in 2001.
===''The Link'' and ''From Mars to Sirius'' (2003−2007)===
The band released their second studio album in 2003, ''[[The Link (album)|The Link]]'' (reissued in 2007 with remastered audio and new booklet artwork).<ref name="about.com Link"> {{cite web | url = http://heavymetal.about.com/b/2007/04/15/gojira-the-link-review.htm | publisher = About.com | title = The Link review | author = Chad Bowar | accessdate = 2008-04-22 }}</ref> After the success of the first two albums and their live performances they made a DVD in [[Bordeaux]] produced by Gabriel Editions. Since 19 May 2004, ''[[The Link Alive]]'' has been on sale in France.<ref name="MSGB" /> In 2005, Gojira decided to sign with French-based [[Listenable Records]] to help give them exposure outside France with the album ''[[From Mars to Sirius]]''.<ref name="OWGB" />
Gojira was featured on [[Children of Bodom]]'s US tour in late 2006, joining [[Amon Amarth]] and [[Sanctity (band)|Sanctity]] as the openers.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=58730 | publisher = [[Blabbermouth.net]] | title = CHILDREN OF BODOM, AMON AMARTH: More North American Tour Dates Announced | author = | accessdate = 2008-04-05 }}</ref> Furthermore, Gojira supported [[Trivium (band)|Trivium]] on the UK dates of their European tour in 2007 with Sanctity and [[Annihilator (band)|Annihilator]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=66553 | publisher = [[Blabbermouth.net]] | title = GOJIRA And SANCTITY Added To TRIVIUM's European Tour | author = | accessdate = 2008-04-05 }}</ref> Later they supported [[Lamb of God (band)|Lamb of God]] on their 2007 American tour along with [[Trivium (band)|Trivium]] and [[Machine Head (band)|Machine Head]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=63629 | publisher = [[Blabbermouth.net]] | title = LAMB OF GOD, MACHINE HEAD, TRIVIUM, GOJIRA: North American Tour Dates Announced | author = | accessdate = 2008-04-05 }}</ref> In late 2007 they took part in the Radio Rebellion Tour, featuring co-headliners [[Behemoth (band)|Behemoth]] and [[Job for a Cowboy]], as well as [[Beneath the Massacre]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=85523 | publisher = [[Blabbermouth.net]] | title = GOJIRA: New Performance Footage Posted Online | author = | accessdate = 2008-04-05 }}</ref> In October 2007, Listenable Records re-released Gojira's 1997 demo ''[[Possessed (Gojira album)|Possessed]]'' as a limited edition.<ref>[http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/Blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=82840 Gojira: 'Xfm Sessions' Recording Posted Online - Oct. 15, 2007], [[Blabbermouth.net]] {{wayback|url=http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/Blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=82840 |date=20071016133124 }}</ref>
===''The Way of All Flesh'' (2008−2011)=== [[File:Gojira live - Nachtleben, Ffm - 2009 - JD - 2.JPG|thumb|right|250px|Christian Andreu and Joe Duplantier live in 2009.]] ''[[The Way of All Flesh (album)|The Way of All Flesh]]'' was released on 13 October in Europe via Listenable Records and 14 October in North America through Prosthetic Records in 2008.<ref name="blabbermouth TWOAF"> {{cite web | url = http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=98427 | publisher = [[Blabbermouth.net]] | title = GOJIRA: New Album Title, Release Date Announced | accessdate = 2008-06-06 }}</ref> On 25 July 2008, the band announced the track listing and revealed the final cover art for the record.<ref name="Album art reveal and track listing announcement"> {{cite web | url = http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=101599 | publisher = [[Blabbermouth.net]] | title = GOJIRA: 'The Way Of All Flesh' Artwork, Track Listing Revealed | accessdate = 2008-07-25 }}</ref> Joe Duplantier stated about the album: "This record is a lot darker — like, a lot darker, I would say. The music is darker and more violent."<ref name="blabbermouth TWOAF2">{{cite web | url = http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=99417 | publisher = [[Blabbermouth.net]] | title = GOJIRA Frontman: 'I'm So Pissed Off With The Situation On Earth Right Now' | author = | accessdate = 2008-06-23 }}</ref> The album will be "more intense, more brutal, and more melodic" than its predecessor.<ref name="blabbermouth TWOAF3">{{cite web | url = http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=98942 | publisher = [[Blabbermouth.net]] | title = GOJIRA Frontman Explains New Album Title | author = | accessdate = 2008-06-23 }}</ref> "That's the theme — it's about death itself," he explained. "It's also about the immortality of the soul. That's the main subject for us".<ref name="blabbermouth TWOAF2" /> [[Randy Blythe]] from the American band [[Lamb of God (band)|Lamb of God]] appeared as a guest vocalist on the song "Adoration for None"<!-- check the album talk page before editing it to All the Tears --><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=100650 | publisher = [[Blabbermouth.net]] | title = LAMB OF GOD Frontman To Guest On New GOJIRA Album - July 10, 2008 | author = | accessdate = 2008-07-20 }}</ref> The album took four months to write and record, and three months to mix.<ref>Minton, James (2008) "Studio Report - Flesh and Blood", ''[[Terrorizer (magazine)|Terrorizer]]'', issue No. 176, November 2008.</ref> On 17 March 2009, the band's first North American headlining tour was announced. Opening bands were [[The Chariot (band)|The Chariot]] and [[Car Bomb (band)|Car Bomb]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=116355 | publisher = [[Blabbermouth.net]] | title = GOJIRA: North American Tour Dates Announced | author = | accessdate = 2008-03-31}}</ref> Gojira accompanied [[Metallica]] on their tour 14 September – 18 October,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blogs.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction%3Dblog.view%26friendID%3D4689215%26blogID%3D499190534 |accessdate=July 8, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090712040156/http://blogs.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=blog.view&friendID=4689215&blogID=499190534 |archivedate=July 12, 2009 }}</ref> performing before Lamb of God. Gojira entered a Los Angeles, California-area studio in early November 2010, with producer [[Logan Mader]] to begin recording a new non-profit four-song EP, the proceeds from which will benefit Sea Shepherd, an anti-whaling organization.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=155324 |title=GOJIRA Working On Material For New Album |date=15 March 2011 |website=[[Blabbermouth.net]] |publisher= |accessdate=22 May 2013}}</ref> According to [[Joe Duplantier]], the EP will feature guest appearances from the international metal scene.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=149044 |title=GOJIRA Recording New EP: Photos From The Studio Available |last1= |first1= |last2= |first2= |date=8 November 2010 |website=[[Blabbermouth.net]] |publisher= |accessdate=22 May 2013}}</ref> "Of Blood And Salt" will feature [[Devin Townsend]] and [[Fredrik Thordendal]]. The other tracks will feature [[Randy Blythe]], [[Anders Fridén]], [[Jonas Renkse]] and [[Max Cavalera]]. As a preview of their ''Sea Shepherd EP'', Gojira released the song "Of Blood And Salt" in May 2011, featuring [[Devin Townsend]] as a guest vocalist and a guest guitar solo performed by [[Fredrik Thordendal]]. As of 2016, the EP has yet to see a release, as the hard drive it was on crashed.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.terrorizer.com/news/news-news/gojira-reveal-reason-for-ep-delay-and-begin-recording-new-album/|title=Gojira reveal reason for EP delay and begin recording new album - Terrorizer|date=2011-10-03|website=Terrorizer|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-06-20}}</ref>
===''L'Enfant Sauvage'' and ''Magma'' (2012−present)=== They were acquired by [[Roadrunner Records]]<ref name="roadrunner_sign_gojira">{{cite web| title = Joe Duplantier: 'Working with Roadrunner Records'| work = gojira-music.com| date = 2011-11-08| url = http://gojira-music.com/news/item/24-roadrunner-records-announces-the-signing-of-gojira| accessdate = 2011-11-23}}</ref> and released ''[[L'Enfant Sauvage (album)|L'Enfant Sauvage]]'' on 4 April 2012 on that label. The title translates to "The Wild Child." The album features 11 tracks, and was released on 26 June 2012. The title song "L'Enfant Sauvage" was released as a single along with a video to support it followed by a release of the song "Liquid Fire" as a free download on Gojira's official website. The album was released 26 June 2012 through Roadrunner Records. On March 11, 2014, Gojira released a Live CD/DVD/Picture book [[Les Enfants Sauvages]], which was recorded at [[Brixton Academy]] London in March 2013.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.gojira-music.com/news/item/189-gojiras-les-enfants-sauvages-out-today | publisher = gojira-music.com | title = Gojira - Official Website - Gojira's DVD "Les Enfants Sauvages" Out Today! | author = | accessdate = 2015-02-18}}</ref>
In November 2014 the band began constructing a recording studio in Queens, New York City. That same month, Mario Duplantier moved to New York.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/gojira-preview-emotional-epic-new-album-20160330?page=3|title=Gojira Preview 'Emotional,' 'Epic' New Album|date=2016-03-30|website=Rolling Stone|access-date=2016-06-20}}</ref>
In an interview conducted in February 2015 with AMH TV, Mario Duplantier stated that the band is working on a new album. Further speaking with AMH TV, he went on to say that "We spent two months... composing new stuff, composing new songs. And we feel very optimistic about the future. We're already enjoying a lot of the new stuff. We want to make the strongest album we can do. I mean, all the bands say they try to make the strongest album, but this time, I think we will really do it."<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.blabbermouth.net/news/gojiras-mario-duplantier-we-want-to-make-the-strongest-album-we-can-do/ | publisher = [[Blabbermouth.net]] | title = GOJIRA's MARIO DUPLANTIER: 'We Want To Make The Strongest Album We Can Do' | author = | accessdate = 2015-02-18}}</ref>
On 4 January 2016, the band posted a video on their [[YouTube]] page announcing the new album would be out in spring.<ref>{{cite web| title = GOJIRA STUDIO SESSIONS - YouTube | date = 2016-01-04| url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kquUmES6Orc| accessdate = 2016-01-11}}</ref>
That same month, Rolling Stone named the album their sixth-most anticipated album of 2016.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.rollingstone.com/music/pictures/25-most-anticipated-metal-albums-of-2016-20160112/gojira-20160109|title=Gojira - 25 Most Anticipated Metal Albums of 2016|website=Rolling Stone|access-date=2016-06-20}}</ref>
In April 2015 the band finished the construction of their New York recording studio, 'Silver Cord Studio'. However, ten days into recording there, Joe and Mario Duplantier learned that their mother had fallen very ill and so the band put the recording session on hold. Their mother later died, and this experience had a profound influence on the recording process.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.blabbermouth.net/news/gojira-releases-stranded-video-unveils-magma-album-artwork/|title=GOJIRA Releases 'Stranded' Video, Unveils 'Magma' Album Artwork|date=2016-04-22|website=BLABBERMOUTH.NET|language=en-US|access-date=2016-06-20}}</ref>
On 13 April 2016, the band released a thirty-second video teaser confirming that the album will be titled ''[[Magma (Gojira album)|Magma]]'' and will be released June 17, 2016 through Roadrunner Records.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://loudwire.com/gojira-magma-release-date-audio-sample/ | publisher = loudwire.com | title = Gojira Reveal New Album 'Magma' Release Date + Audio Sample | author = Joe DiVita | accessdate = 2016-04-13}}</ref> They followed this with the release of the first song from ''Magma'', titled "Stranded", on 22 April.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/gojira-tease-emotional-new-lp-with-disturbing-stranded-video-20160422|title=Gojira Tease Emotional New LP With Disturbing 'Stranded' Video|date=2016-04-22|website=Rolling Stone|access-date=2016-06-20}}</ref> The single's music video was directed by Vincent Caldoni.<ref name=":1" /> On 20 May 2016, a second song, "Silvera", was released, accompanied by a music video directed by Drew Cox.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/watch-metal-outfit-gojiras-startling-engrossing-silvera-video-20160519|title=Watch Metal Outfit Gojira's Startling, Engrossing 'Silvera' Video|date=2016-05-20|website=Rolling Stone|access-date=2016-06-20}}</ref>
''Magma'' was officially released on June 17, 2016 through Roadrunner Records to "universal critical acclaim".<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/music/magma/gojira|title=Magma by Gojira|website=Metacritic|access-date=2016-06-20}}</ref> The album marked a change in style for the band, with Joe Duplantier experimenting with clean vocals, and with Mario commenting that "this time, we just felt all together that we wanted something straight to the point more. We wanted to change the dynamic."<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.blabbermouth.net/news/gojiras-mario-duplantier-on-magma-album-we-wanted-to-change-the-dynamic/|title=GOJIRA's MARIO DUPLANTIER On 'Magma' Album: 'We Wanted To Change The Dynamic'|date=2016-06-20|website=BLABBERMOUTH.NET|language=en-US|access-date=2016-06-20}}</ref> The band will tour North America with [[Tesseract (band)|Tesseract]] from mid-July through October 2016 in support of the album.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://loudwire.com/gojira-2016-north-american-tour-tesseract/|title=Gojira Announce 2016 North American Tour With Tesseract|website=Loudwire|access-date=2016-06-20}}</ref> In 2016, the band will tour the United Kingdom with [[Alter Bridge]], [[Volbeat]], and [[Like a Storm]].<ref>http://www.rocksins.com/2016/07/alter-bridge-volbeat-gojira-like-storm-team-enormous-2016-uk-arena-tour-28094/</ref>
==Side projects==
Joe Duplantier was invited by the founding brothers of influential Brazilian band [[Sepultura]], [[Max Cavalera|Max]] and [[Igor Cavalera]], to join their new band [[Cavalera Conspiracy]] as a bassist. The album ''[[Inflikted]]'' was released in March 2008 and a tour followed in mid-2008.<ref name="RRCC Bio"> {{cite web | url = http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/artists/CavaleraConspiracy/bio.aspx?bio=official | publisher = Roadrunner Records | title = Cavalera Conspiracy Biography | accessdate = 2008-05-04 | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080402014835/http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/artists/cavaleraconspiracy/bio.aspx?bio=official <!--Added by H3llBot--> | archivedate = 2008-04-02 }}</ref> Also, the Duplantier brothers formed an [[avant-garde metal]] band called [[Empalot]] in 1998, starring Stéphane Chateauneuf, who appears in The Link Alive DVD's short show called "Thang & Tanguy". Their first release was a demo album called ''[[Brout (album)|Brout]]''. It was released in 1998. Two albums followed: ''[[Tous aux Cèpes]]'' in 2001 and a live CD called ''[[Empalot en Concert]]'' in 2004.<ref name="Wikipedia FR"> [[:fr:Empalot (groupe)]]</ref>
==Musical style and lyrical themes== Gojira's sound is not easily classifiable as they blend several styles.<ref name="MSGB"/><ref name="tmf">{{cite web | url = http://www.themetalforge.com/modules.php?name=Reviews&rop=showcontent&id=588 | publisher = The Metal Forge | title = From Mars to Sirius review | author = Simon Milburn | accessdate = 2008-04-20 }}</ref> Genres that have been associated with Gojira are [[technical death metal]],<ref>Lissa Brennan, [http://www.pittsburghcitypaper.ws/gyrobase/Content?oid=oid%3A70138 With French death-metal pioneers Gojira, the lyrics matter as much as the blastbeats], pittsburghcitypaper.ws, 15 October 2009.</ref> [[progressive metal]], [[groove metal]] and [[thrash metal]]. Gojira has been influenced by [[heavy metal music|heavy metal]] artists such as [[Slayer]],<ref>{{cite web| last= | first= | title= Slayer Stories from Pantera, Slash, Slipknot, Korn, Rob Zombie, Johnny Knoxville, Deftones, Gojira, and more| work=artistdirect.com | url = http://www.artistdirect.com/nad/news/article/0,,10722882,00.html| accessdate =October 13, 2013}}</ref> [[Sepultura]], [[Death (metal band)|Death]], [[Morbid Angel]], [[Meshuggah]], [[Tool (band)|Tool]], [[Metallica]], [[Pantera]], and [[Neurosis (band)|Neurosis]].<ref name="about.com FMTS">{{cite web | url = http://heavymetal.about.com/od/cdreviews/fr/gojira.htm | publisher = About.com | title = From Mars to Sirius review | author = Chad Bowar | accessdate = 2008-03-14 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.myspace.com/gojira | publisher = [[MySpace]] | title = Gojira entry | author = | quote = Morbid Angel, Metallica, Tool, Meshuggah, Neurosis, Death | accessdate = 2008-03-14 }}</ref>
Gojira plays a technical and rhythmic style of heavy metal with precision drumming along with [[blast beat]]s, unusual rhythm patterns, and start-and-stop riffs. Gojira has also been known to incorporate textured atmospheric elements and instrumental songs into their music.<ref name="about.com Link" /> Gojira songs have progressive and uncommon [[song structure]]s, rarely using the standard [[Verse-chorus form|verse, chorus, verse]] [[songwriting]].<ref name="about.com Link" />The vocal style is varied, ranging from the screamed style often employed in extreme metal, with the death growl style predominantly used in death metal, in addition to clean vocals and higher screams. At times, death metal growls and clean vocals are mixed to create an aggressive but melodic effect.<ref name="tmf" /><ref name="about.com FMTS"/>
Gojira's lyrics tackle themes of life, death, rebirth, spirituality, and nature. <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.metalinjection.net/upcoming-releases/gojira-frontman-talks-lyrical-themes-upcoming-album|title=GOJIRA Frontman Talks Lyrical Themes Of Upcoming Album - Metal Injection|date=2011-08-29|website=Metal Injection|language=en-US|access-date=2016-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.nocleansinging.com/2010/08/01/gojira-is-the-best/|title=NO CLEAN SINGING » Why Gojira is the Best Metal Band in the World|access-date=2016-06-20}}</ref> In particular, their 2005 album ''[[From Mars to Sirius]]'' is a concept album tackling environmental issues as well as broader themes of life, death, and rebirth.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.metalsucks.net/2009/06/24/9-gojira-from-mars-to-sirius/|title=#9: GOJIRA - FROM MARS TO SIRIUS|date=2009-06-24|website=MetalSucks|access-date=2016-06-20}}</ref>
The members of the band were raised in [[Bayonne]], a city on the south west coast of France ([[Pyrénées-Atlantiques]]/[[French Basque Country]]). The surrounding scenic countryside and rugged coastline inspired Gojira's interest in nature and the earth. Gojira uses its lyrics to spread its spiritual beliefs and concerns for the environment.<ref name="OWGB"> {{cite web | url = http://www.gojira-music.com/ | title = Gojira Biography | publisher = Official Gojira Website | author = Lucy Williams | accessdate = 2008-05-04 }}</ref> They also cooperate with [[Sea Shepherd Conservation Society]] to protect marine animals, especially dolphins, whales and sharks. Members from Sea Shepherd Conservation Society are allowed to run a merchandise booth at Gojira gigs. In addition, Gojira is working on the Sea Shepherd EP with well-known musicians from the metal scene, including [[Devin Townsend]]. All proceeds from the project will go to the organization, though as of June 2016 the current status of this project is unknown.<ref name="entertaim"> {{cite web | url = http://entertaimnet.wordpress.com/2013/04/02/gojira-to-serve-and-to-protect/ | title = Gojira Interview Joe | publisher = entertaim.net | author = Dennis Rowehl(entertaim.net) | accessdate = 2013-04-22 }}</ref>
